title: Rotational work - bicycle wheel with brake

content.question: A chain attached to the bicycle wheel shown in the figure exerts a clockwise torque of constant magnitude <math alttext="tau" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>τ</mi></math> on the wheel. A brake pad, which is a distance <math alttext="R sub b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi>b</mi></msub></math> from the wheel’s axle, exerts a force of constant magnitude <math alttext="F sub b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>b</mi></msub></math> directed to the left. What is the net work done on the wheel as it rotates through an angular displacement <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> ?
